meanings.definition: A painful swelling on the first joint of the big toe.
meanings.sent1: Her bunions made it hard for her to walk comfortably.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended surgery to treat her bunions.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her bunions were like little toe mountains.
meanings.sent4: The bunions on her feet felt like tiny pebbles under her skin.
meanings.sent5: Every step she took was a reminder of the pain caused by her bunions.

meanings.definition: A bony bump that forms on the joint at the base of the big toe.
meanings.sent1: His bunions were so large, they rubbed against his shoes.
meanings.sent2: Wearing tight shoes can worsen the development of bunions.
meanings.sent3: The bunion on his foot looked like a small bone island.
meanings.sent4: The bunions protruded from his feet like tiny hills.
meanings.sent5: The pressure on his bunions made each step excruciating.

meanings.definition: A deformity of the foot marked by a swollen, bony bump at the base of the big toe.
meanings.sent1: Her bunions caused her constant discomfort while walking.
meanings.sent2: Bunions can be hereditary and run in families.
meanings.sent3: He affectionately referred to his bunions as his 'toe buddies'.
meanings.sent4: The bunions on her feet felt like unwelcome guests at a party.
meanings.sent5: The bunions on her feet were a visible reminder of her foot deformity.
